did.abstract: One scrapbook documenting the career of William Watson Clark as a pitcher for the Brooklyn Robins, Brooklyn Dodgers, and New York Giants. Items date from circa 1928 to 1938. Items in the scrapbook include clippings, tickets to Ebbets Field, baseball cards, and other ephemera. The scrapbook was compiled by Watson's wife.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Watson Clark (1902-1972), known as "Watty" or "Lefty" Clark, was a professional baseball pitcher who was active from 1924 to 1937. Clark debuted with the Cleveland Indians, and went on to pitch for the Brooklyn Robins, Brooklyn Dodgers, and New York Giants.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One scrapbook documenting the career of William Watson Clark as a pitcher for the Brooklyn Robins, Brooklyn Dodgers, and New York Giants. Items date from circa 1928 to 1938. Items in the scrapbook include clippings, tickets to Ebbets Field, baseball cards, and other ephemera. The scrapbook was compiled by Watson's wife.
